conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a french movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Bonjour! I think you might enjoy "To Have and Have Not" (1937), a classic French-American film set during World War II, featuring Humphrey Bogart in one of his most iconic roles. The movie's mix of romance, adventure, and espionage will surely transport you to the charming island of Martinique.

If you're looking for something more modern, I'd recommend "Ocean's Thirteen" (2007), a fun and stylish heist film with an all-star cast, including George Clooney and Brad Pitt. The movie's witty dialogue and clever plot twists make it a great choice for anyone who loves French flair!
